definition: to strike a severe blow/to crack down/to take strong measures

sentences.english: While she could be strict, she could also be a real “softie.
sentences.chinese: 她既有严厉的一面，同时也真的是一个感性的人。

sentences.english: The professor lambasted me for my careless mistake.
sentences.chinese: 教授严厉批评了我的粗心错误。

sentences.english: In his latest article he lashed into those terrorists.
sentences.chinese: 他在最近一篇文章中严厉抨击了那些恐怖主义分子。

sentences.english: One of the jurors immediately declares himself in favour of the utmost rigour of the law being applied to the young woman.
sentences.chinese: 有一名陪审员当即宣布希望能用最严厉的法律制裁她。

sentences.english: Ex: My father is a hard-nosed man.
sentences.chinese: 我老爸是个严厉的男人。

sentences.english: But Paul Feyerabend criticized this action sharply.
sentences.chinese: 费耶阿本德却对此举提出了严厉批评。

sentences.english: Scolding a child will do more harm than good.
sentences.chinese: 严厉责骂孩子弊多利少。

sentences.english: The coach reamed out the whole team.
sentences.chinese: 教练把全体队员严厉地批评了一顿。

sentences.english: He pledged to crack down on rising crime.
sentences.chinese: 他承诺将严厉打击犯罪上升。

sentences.english: Don't take yourself so seriously. Nobody else does.
sentences.chinese: 不要总对自己那么严厉，没有人会这样。

sentences.english: Cruelty to animals is severely punished in England.
sentences.chinese: 在英国，虐待动物要受严厉惩罚。

sentences.english: Your eyes show sternness, but more kindness and care.
sentences.chinese: 您的眼神看起来很严厉，但更多的是仁慈和关心。

sentences.english: I don't want to be hard on your daughter ; she shan't be pressed .
sentences.chinese: 我不想对你女儿太严厉，她不会太受压的。

sentences.english: EXAMPLE: Our boss was a stern old grinch who made us work on holidays.
sentences.chinese: 我们的严厉老板总是败人兴致，让我们在假日加班。

sentences.english: Chinese authorities have since put the boot into Boten.
sentences.chinese: 此后中国当局对磨丁进行了严厉的指责。

sentences.english: Stiff reparations for war damages were to be paid—by the Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 中国承担严厉的战争赔款。

definition: to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 喝斥[he1 chi4]
